title: Shawl, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique embroidery in colored silks  on white silk - polychrome fringe
provenance: ex collection of John Russell Young [who gave it to Mrs. Charles Warren Crane], and ex collection of Mrs. Charles Warren Crane.
dimensions: H x W: 226 x 226 cm (7 ft. 5 in. x 7 ft. 5 in.)
description: Flowers and insects arranged in central and border ornaments - donor says this came "from the Palace of the old Empress," and was given to her mother [Mrs. Charles Warren Crane] by John Russell Young "our first ambassador to China, who accompanied General Grant in his trip around the world." Shawl lined with silk and used as table cover.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl, 19th century. Medium: silk
Technique embroidery in colored silks  on white silk - polychrome fringe. 1945-27-5-a.
